{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.20622v1", "title": "The Graded Dual of a Combinatorial Hopf Algebra on Partition Diagrams", "summary": "John M. Campbell constructed a combinatorial Hopf algebra (CHA) \text{ParSym}
on partition diagrams by lifting the CHA structure of \text{NSym} (the Hopf
algebra of noncommutative symmetric functions) through an analogous approach.
In this article, we define \text{ParQSym}, which is the graded dual of
\text{ParSym}. Its CHA structure is defined in an explicit, combinatorial way,
by analogy with that of the CHA \text{QSym} of quasisymmetric functions. And we
give some subcoalgebra and Hopf subalgebras of \text{ParQSym}, some gradings
and filtrations of \text{ParSym} and \text{ParQSym}, and some bases of
\text{ParSym} and \text{ParQSym} by analogy with some distinguished bases of
\text{NSym} and \text{QSym}.", "main_category": "math.RA", "categories": "math.RA", "published": "2025-04-29T10:45:30Z"}
